item.title: The UAE’s Music Scene Boom: Era of Growth
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
The music scene in the UAE has witnessed rapid growth in the past few years. According to Statista, the Music Events market is forecasted to generate a revenue of $142.00 million in 2025. With an anticipated annual growth rate (CAGR) of 1.14% from 2025 to 2028, the market is projected to reach a total revenue of $146.90 million by 2028. With a growing emphasis on entertainment and the UAE’s vibrant, cultural landscape, the country is attracting a diverse range of melody enthusiasts from across the globe.  World-Class Venues The UAE boasts a diverse range of state-of-the-art venues, from intimate clubs and theaters to massive arenas and open-air amphitheaters. Iconic, government-supported venues like the Etihad Arena on Yas Island and the Coca-Cola Arena and Dubai Opera in Dubai are attracting global superstars and hosting major festivals, further contributing to the transformation in the music scene in the country. Coca-Cola Arena, Dubai. Photo credits to TimeOut Dubai Government investments in infrastructure, along with initiatives like Dubai Expo 2020, solidify the UAE’s status as a cultural hub, according to Rajesh Pereira, founder and CEO of Matrix AV. The country boasts world-class venues, cutting-edge rehearsal studios, and a growing number of music festivals. In Coca-Cola Arena alone, over 26 various entertainment events have been scheduled from January till May 2025.  In Abu Dhabi, entertainment continues to boom, notably with Coldplay concerts currently taking place in Zayed Sports City Stadium, attracting over 160,000 attendees.    Impact on Hotel Occupancy The highlight of this year has got to be the Coldplay concert. The sold-out, 4-day concert has attracted residents and visitors to the UAE. Rikant Pittie, co-founder of EaseMyTrip, noted a significant surge in hotel prices for the concert weekend (January 10-12), with some properties increasing rates by as much as 300%. “Rooms that were previously available for Dh 492 are now priced at Dh 801, and others have risen to over Dh 1,500,” he stated. Rove Expo City, photo credits to: Booking.com Concert attendees looking to stay near Dubai Expo, the designated pickup point at Expo City, may opt for Rove Expo City. Room rates for a stay from January 11 to 12 are priced at Dh1,198 per night. These higher prices will remain in effect until January 14, the concert’s final day. Following the event, rates at Rove Expo City drop to Dh319, representing a 115% increase during the concert period.  Abu Dhabi: City of Music In 2021, Abu Dhabi was designated as “City of Music” by the UNESCO Creative City Network. As part of the Abu Dhabi Cultural Strategy, the Abu Dhabi UNESCO City of Music initiative is dedicated to engaging the community in celebrating global music, in collaboration with cultural partners such as the Abu Dhabi Music and Arts Foundation and New York University Abu Dhabi. Abu Dhabi Culture presents the Abu Dhabi Music Programme, which fosters rich dialogue around music from diverse cultures. Through initiatives like Abu Dhabi Classics, Bait Al Oud Series, Sound of UAE, and Umsiyat, the Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi showcases leading artists in both Arabic and Western classical music.  Looking Ahead The UAE’s music sector is poised for continued growth. With ongoing investments in infrastructure, a focus on developing local talent, and a commitment to creating a vibrant and inclusive ecosystem, the country is well-positioned to become a leading destination for music lovers worldwide. Buckle up this 2025 as the upcoming festivals and concerts in the UAE promise to deliver unparalleled experiences for everyone.    Disclaimer: This article provides general information and should not be considered financial or investment advice.

The post The UAE’s Music Scene Boom: Era of Growth appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
The music scene in the UAE has witnessed rapid growth in the past few years. According to Statista, the Music Events market is forecasted to generate a revenue of $142.00 million in 2025. With an anticipated annual growth rate (CAGR) of 1.14% from 2025 to 2028, the market is projected to reach a total revenue of $146.90 million by 2028. With a growing emphasis on entertainment and the UAE’s vibrant, cultural landscape, the country is attracting a diverse range of melody enthusiasts from across the globe. 

World-Class Venues

The UAE boasts a diverse range of state-of-the-art venues, from intimate clubs and theaters to massive arenas and open-air amphitheaters. Iconic, government-supported venues like the Etihad Arena on Yas Island and the Coca-Cola Arena and Dubai Opera in Dubai are attracting global superstars and hosting major festivals, further contributing to the transformation in the music scene in the country.
 
Coca-Cola Arena, Dubai. Photo credits to TimeOut Dubai
 
Government investments in infrastructure, along with initiatives like Dubai Expo 2020, solidify the UAE’s status as a cultural hub, according to Rajesh Pereira, founder and CEO of Matrix AV. The country boasts world-class venues, cutting-edge rehearsal studios, and a growing number of music festivals.
 
In Coca-Cola Arena alone, over 26 various entertainment events have been scheduled from January till May 2025.  In Abu Dhabi, entertainment continues to boom, notably with Coldplay concerts currently taking place in Zayed Sports City Stadium, attracting over 160,000 attendees. 
 
 

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More
Edit Template

Impact on Hotel Occupancy

The highlight of this year has got to be the Coldplay concert. The sold-out, 4-day concert has attracted residents and visitors to the UAE. Rikant Pittie, co-founder of EaseMyTrip, noted a significant surge in hotel prices for the concert weekend (January 10-12), with some properties increasing rates by as much as 300%. “Rooms that were previously available for Dh 492 are now priced at Dh 801, and others have risen to over Dh 1,500,” he stated.
 
Rove Expo City, photo credits to: Booking.com
 
Concert attendees looking to stay near Dubai Expo, the designated pickup point at Expo City, may opt for Rove Expo City. Room rates for a stay from January 11 to 12 are priced at Dh1,198 per night. These higher prices will remain in effect until January 14, the concert’s final day. Following the event, rates at Rove Expo City drop to Dh319, representing a 115% increase during the concert period.
 

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

Abu Dhabi: City of Music

In 2021, Abu Dhabi was designated as “City of Music” by the UNESCO Creative City Network. As part of the Abu Dhabi Cultural Strategy, the Abu Dhabi UNESCO City of Music initiative is dedicated to engaging the community in celebrating global music, in collaboration with cultural partners such as the Abu Dhabi Music and Arts Foundation and New York University Abu Dhabi.
 
Abu Dhabi Culture presents the Abu Dhabi Music Programme, which fosters rich dialogue around music from diverse cultures. Through initiatives like Abu Dhabi Classics, Bait Al Oud Series, Sound of UAE, and Umsiyat, the Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi showcases leading artists in both Arabic and Western classical music.
 

Looking Ahead

The UAE’s music sector is poised for continued growth. With ongoing investments in infrastructure, a focus on developing local talent, and a commitment to creating a vibrant and inclusive ecosystem, the country is well-positioned to become a leading destination for music lovers worldwide. Buckle up this 2025 as the upcoming festivals and concerts in the UAE promise to deliver unparalleled experiences for everyone. 

 
Disclaimer: This article provides general information and should not be considered financial or investment advice.

item.title: 2025: A Game-Changer for Northern Emirates Real Estate
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
As the UAE’s real estate sector continues to thrive, the Northern Emirates are emerging as a key player in the market, ready to capture the spotlight in 2025. With rapid infrastructure development, competitive property prices, and growing investor interest, regions like Ras Al Khaimah, Ajman, Sharjah, and Umm Al Quwain are carving a niche in the country’s booming real estate landscape. This year promises to be a turning point, highlighting the Northern Emirates’ potential as attractive hubs for residential, commercial, and tourism-focused investments.  1. Ras Al Khaimah This northern emirate, long overshadowed by its neighboring emirates, Dubai and Abu Dhabi, Ras Al Khaimah is now emerging as one of the UAE’s most promising real estate destinations for property investors. With ambitious developments, strong government support, and a flourishing tourism sector, Ras Al Khaimah is forging a new identity as the rising star of the UAE’s real estate market.  The rising appeal of RAK mainly stems from iconic developments, such as the eagerly awaited Wynn Casino and Resort on Al Marjan Island. Valued at $3.9 billion, this groundbreaking project—the first of its kind in the Middle East—is set to be completed by 2027.   Shattering Sales Records Since the Covid-19 pandemic, Ras Al Khaimah’s real estate market has achieved record-breaking growth. Official data from the Ras Al Khaimah Statistics Center reveals that real estate transactions during the first three quarters of 2024 skyrocketed to just below AED 12 billion, a staggering increase compared to AED 3,84 billion 1 in 2020, reflecting a surge of over 70%.  2. Sharjah The next northern emirate gaining momentum in the real estate market is the city of Sharjah. Known for its strategic location between Dubai and Ajman, Sharjah enhances accessibility, which drives demand for both commercial and residential properties. Additionally, Sharjah’s competitive property prices—significantly lower than neighboring Dubai—attract a diverse range of investors, from first-time buyers to those seeking rental income opportunities.  Al Thuraya Island, Sharjah, UAE  As of November 2024, Sharjah’s real estate market achieved impressive milestones, recording AED 4 billion in transactions across 4,606 deals, spanning a total of 20.4 million square feet. These robust figures, supported by visionary leadership, reinforce Sharjah’s status as a key real estate hub and a leading global economic region. 3. Ajman Ajman’s strategic location and excellent connectivity are key factors in its appeal as a real estate investment hub. Nestled along the scenic Arabian Gulf coast and adjacent to Sharjah, Ajman is just a short distance from Dubai, one of the region’s most vibrant business and leisure centers. This prime positioning establishes Ajman as a focal point for trade, commerce, and tourism, offering significant advantages to both residents and investors. Marina-Front Gateway, Al Zorah City, Ajman, UAE  As of Q3 2024, Ajman recorded 1,277 real estate transactions worth AED 1.95 billion, with trading volume surpassing AED 1.4 billion across 1,033 deals. Real estate activity grew by 21.8% compared to the same period in 2023, with the “Rumaila 3” district leading in sales at AED 100 million. Ajman’s flexible market, high-quality properties, and competitive offerings continue to attract diverse investors, catering to varying needs and preferences. 4. Umm Al Quwain Last but not least, Umm Al Quwain has been witnessing rising interest, especially since the launch of waterfront developments on the luxurious Siniya Island by Sobha Realty. The northern emirate’s strategic location between Sharjah and Ras Al Khaimah, its growing population, and its commitment to sustainability make it a promising investment destination. With initiatives like the Sustainable Blue Economy Strategy and developments such as the Free Trade Zone, the emirate is poised for economic growth.  Siniya Island, Umm Al Quwain, UAE.  The luxury development of Siniya Island is taking shape on one of the UAE’s largest natural islands, set to redefine Umm Al Quwain. Valued at $5 billion, the first phase of Sobha Siniya Island will feature 8,000 units, accommodating over 25,000 residents upon completion. Phase 1 of the project has witnessed huge success, with more success to come by 2025, redefining luxury living in this tranquil emirate. 

The post 2025: A Game-Changer for Northern Emirates Real Estate appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
As the UAE’s real estate sector continues to thrive, the Northern Emirates are emerging as a key player in the market, ready to capture the spotlight in 2025. With rapid infrastructure development, competitive property prices, and growing investor interest, regions like Ras Al Khaimah, Ajman, Sharjah, and Umm Al Quwain are carving a niche in the country’s booming real estate landscape. This year promises to be a turning point, highlighting the Northern Emirates’ potential as attractive hubs for residential, commercial, and tourism-focused investments. 

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

1. Ras Al Khaimah

This northern emirate, long overshadowed by its neighboring emirates, Dubai and Abu Dhabi, Ras Al Khaimah is now emerging as one of the UAE’s most promising real estate destinations for property investors. With ambitious developments, strong government support, and a flourishing tourism sector, Ras Al Khaimah is forging a new identity as the rising star of the UAE’s real estate market.
 

The rising appeal of RAK mainly stems from iconic developments, such as the eagerly awaited Wynn Casino and Resort on Al Marjan Island. Valued at $3.9 billion, this groundbreaking project—the first of its kind in the Middle East—is set to be completed by 2027. 
 

Shattering Sales Records

Since the Covid-19 pandemic, Ras Al Khaimah’s real estate market has achieved record-breaking growth. Official data from the Ras Al Khaimah Statistics Center reveals that real estate transactions during the first three quarters of 2024 skyrocketed to just below AED 12 billion, a staggering increase compared to AED 3,84 billion 1 in 2020, reflecting a surge of over 70%.
 

2. Sharjah

The next northern emirate gaining momentum in the real estate market is the city of Sharjah. Known for its strategic location between Dubai and Ajman, Sharjah enhances accessibility, which drives demand for both commercial and residential properties. Additionally, Sharjah’s competitive property prices—significantly lower than neighboring Dubai—attract a diverse range of investors, from first-time buyers to those seeking rental income opportunities. 
 
Al Thuraya Island, Sharjah, UAE
 

As of November 2024, Sharjah’s real estate market achieved impressive milestones, recording AED 4 billion in transactions across 4,606 deals, spanning a total of 20.4 million square feet. These robust figures, supported by visionary leadership, reinforce Sharjah’s status as a key real estate hub and a leading global economic region.

3. Ajman

Ajman’s strategic location and excellent connectivity are key factors in its appeal as a real estate investment hub. Nestled along the scenic Arabian Gulf coast and adjacent to Sharjah, Ajman is just a short distance from Dubai, one of the region’s most vibrant business and leisure centers. This prime positioning establishes Ajman as a focal point for trade, commerce, and tourism, offering significant advantages to both residents and investors.
 
Marina-Front Gateway, Al Zorah City, Ajman, UAE
 

As of Q3 2024, Ajman recorded 1,277 real estate transactions worth AED 1.95 billion, with trading volume surpassing AED 1.4 billion across 1,033 deals. Real estate activity grew by 21.8% compared to the same period in 2023, with the “Rumaila 3” district leading in sales at AED 100 million. Ajman’s flexible market, high-quality properties, and competitive offerings continue to attract diverse investors, catering to varying needs and preferences.

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

4. Umm Al Quwain

Last but not least, Umm Al Quwain has been witnessing rising interest, especially since the launch of waterfront developments on the luxurious Siniya Island by Sobha Realty. The northern emirate’s strategic location between Sharjah and Ras Al Khaimah, its growing population, and its commitment to sustainability make it a promising investment destination. With initiatives like the Sustainable Blue Economy Strategy and developments such as the Free Trade Zone, the emirate is poised for economic growth. 

Siniya Island, Umm Al Quwain, UAE.
 

The luxury development of Siniya Island is taking shape on one of the UAE’s largest natural islands, set to redefine Umm Al Quwain. Valued at $5 billion, the first phase of Sobha Siniya Island will feature 8,000 units, accommodating over 25,000 residents upon completion. Phase 1 of the project has witnessed huge success, with more success to come by 2025, redefining luxury living in this tranquil emirate.

item.title: UAE Properties on High Demand as of December 2024
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
The UAE’s real estate market continues to shine as one of the most sought-after investment destinations globally. As December 2024 unfolds, the demand for properties across the Emirates has reached unprecedented heights, fueled by a perfect blend of economic growth, visionary developments, and a steady influx of investors. From luxurious villas to premium waterfront apartments, the diverse range of properties offers unmatched appeal to buyers and investors alike.  1. Bay Grove Residences Bay Grove Residences offers a dynamic residential experience with four interconnected buildings set atop a lush green podium. Choose from a selection of 1-, 2-, and 3-bedroom apartments, as well as 4-bedroom duplexes, each thoughtfully crafted to provide sophisticated private retreats for individuals and families alike. Residents can enjoy a beachfront elevated ocean pool, play areas, podium gardens, sunlit walkways, and stunning sea views.   This development’s allure lies in its prime location within the prestigious Dubai Islands. As one of the city’s rare waterfront destinations, Dubai Islands stands out by offering unparalleled premium services. With waterfront properties in Dubai becoming increasingly scarce, this exclusive location perfectly caters to the growing demand for luxurious coastal living.  Unit Type: 1 -3 bedroom apartments. 4 bedroom penthousesPayment Plan: 70/30 with 20% down payment Handover: Q4 2028Starting Price: AED 1,900,000 2. Coral Beach Villas Sobha Coral Beach Villas on Siniya Island is an exquisite luxury residential development by Sobha Group, offering a limited collection of 5 to 7 bedroom villas in Umm Al Quwain. These exceptional homes embody the perfect harmony of natural beauty and refined luxury, providing an unparalleled beachfront living experience. Each villa exudes contemporary sophistication, surrounded by lush mangroves, pristine beaches, and breathtaking views of the Arabian Gulf. Siniya Island stands out as a rare gem in the UAE’s real estate landscape, offering limited waterfront properties that are highly sought after. This prime location combines seclusion and accessibility, being close to Dubai and Sharjah while maintaining a tranquil atmosphere surrounded by mangroves and pristine beaches. Investors can capitalize on its status as a popular tourist destination, benefiting from short-term rental demand driven by its resorts, marina, and natural beauty.   Unit Type: 5 – 7 bedroom villasPayment Plan: 60/40 with 20% down payment  Handover: Q2 2028Starting Price: AED 17,700,000  3. Ellington Cove Ellington Cove at Dubai Islands introduces the latest in luxury living by the esteemed Ellington Properties, featuring an exclusive range of studios, 1-, 2-, and 3-bedroom apartments, duplexes, and 4-bedroom penthouses. Designed for leisure and tranquility, the serene promenade and innovative architecture foster a vibrant sense of community, creating a perfect environment for families to flourish.  Ellington Cove enjoys a prime location on Dubai Islands, just minutes away from a world-class golf course and a vibrant marina. The development is surrounded by upscale restaurants and a luxury yacht club, making it an appealing choice for investors seeking strong returns in one of Dubai’s most sought-after waterfront locations.    Unit Type: 1 – 3 bedroom apartments, duplexes, and 4-bedroom penthousesPayment Plan: 70/30 with 20% down payment  Handover: Q2 2028Starting Price: Ask for Price 4. Golf Acres Golf Acres at Emaar South offers a harmonious blend of luxury and nature, featuring stunning golf course views, fine dining, and top-tier amenities, including a clubhouse, driving range, and wellness-focused outdoor spaces. The development provides a range of exclusive 1- to 3-bedroom apartments and 3-bedroom townhouses, complemented by eco-friendly community parks, children’s play areas, multi-purpose courts, and event spaces. Nestled in Dubai South, home to the upcoming largest airport, Al Maktoum International Airport, this community offers attractive returns for long-term investment. With strong demand from professionals working in the area and tourists visiting the airport, properties in Dubai South can generate attractive rental yields. Unit Type:  1 – 3 bedroom apartments; 3-bedroom townhousesPayment Plan: 80/20 with 10% down payment  Handover: Q4 2028Starting Price: AED 950,000

The post UAE Properties on High Demand as of December 2024 appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
The UAE’s real estate market continues to shine as one of the most sought-after investment destinations globally. As December 2024 unfolds, the demand for properties across the Emirates has reached unprecedented heights, fueled by a perfect blend of economic growth, visionary developments, and a steady influx of investors. From luxurious villas to premium waterfront apartments, the diverse range of properties offers unmatched appeal to buyers and investors alike. 

1. Bay Grove Residences

Bay Grove Residences offers a dynamic residential experience with four interconnected buildings set atop a lush green podium. Choose from a selection of 1-, 2-, and 3-bedroom apartments, as well as 4-bedroom duplexes, each thoughtfully crafted to provide sophisticated private retreats for individuals and families alike. Residents can enjoy a beachfront elevated ocean pool, play areas, podium gardens, sunlit walkways, and stunning sea views. 
 
This development’s allure lies in its prime location within the prestigious Dubai Islands. As one of the city’s rare waterfront destinations, Dubai Islands stands out by offering unparalleled premium services. With waterfront properties in Dubai becoming increasingly scarce, this exclusive location perfectly caters to the growing demand for luxurious coastal living.
 

Unit Type: 1 -3 bedroom apartments. 4 bedroom penthouses
Payment Plan: 70/30 with 20% down payment 
Handover: Q4 2028
Starting Price: AED 1,900,000

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

2. Coral Beach Villas

Sobha Coral Beach Villas on Siniya Island is an exquisite luxury residential development by Sobha Group, offering a limited collection of 5 to 7 bedroom villas in Umm Al Quwain. These exceptional homes embody the perfect harmony of natural beauty and refined luxury, providing an unparalleled beachfront living experience. Each villa exudes contemporary sophistication, surrounded by lush mangroves, pristine beaches, and breathtaking views of the Arabian Gulf.

Siniya Island stands out as a rare gem in the UAE’s real estate landscape, offering limited waterfront properties that are highly sought after. This prime location combines seclusion and accessibility, being close to Dubai and Sharjah while maintaining a tranquil atmosphere surrounded by mangroves and pristine beaches. Investors can capitalize on its status as a popular tourist destination, benefiting from short-term rental demand driven by its resorts, marina, and natural beauty.

 

Unit Type: 5 – 7 bedroom villas
Payment Plan: 60/40 with 20% down payment 
Handover: Q2 2028
Starting Price: AED 17,700,000 

3. Ellington Cove

Ellington Cove at Dubai Islands introduces the latest in luxury living by the esteemed Ellington Properties, featuring an exclusive range of studios, 1-, 2-, and 3-bedroom apartments, duplexes, and 4-bedroom penthouses. Designed for leisure and tranquility, the serene promenade and innovative architecture foster a vibrant sense of community, creating a perfect environment for families to flourish.
 

Ellington Cove enjoys a prime location on Dubai Islands, just minutes away from a world-class golf course and a vibrant marina. The development is surrounded by upscale restaurants and a luxury yacht club, making it an appealing choice for investors seeking strong returns in one of Dubai’s most sought-after waterfront locations. 

 

Unit Type: 1 – 3 bedroom apartments, duplexes, and 4-bedroom penthouses
Payment Plan: 70/30 with 20% down payment 
Handover: Q2 2028
Starting Price: Ask for Price

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

4. Golf Acres

Golf Acres at Emaar South offers a harmonious blend of luxury and nature, featuring stunning golf course views, fine dining, and top-tier amenities, including a clubhouse, driving range, and wellness-focused outdoor spaces. The development provides a range of exclusive 1- to 3-bedroom apartments and 3-bedroom townhouses, complemented by eco-friendly community parks, children’s play areas, multi-purpose courts, and event spaces.

Nestled in Dubai South, home to the upcoming largest airport, Al Maktoum International Airport, this community offers attractive returns for long-term investment. With strong demand from professionals working in the area and tourists visiting the airport, properties in Dubai South can generate attractive rental yields.

Unit Type:  1 – 3 bedroom apartments; 3-bedroom townhouses
Payment Plan: 80/20 with 10% down payment 
Handover: Q4 2028
Starting Price: AED 950,000

item.title: Brewing Luxury: Coffee Culture Boom in the UAE
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
Coffee has taken center stage as an integral part of the social and cultural landscape in the UAE, with over 8,800 operating cafés across the country. The UAE is experiencing a dynamic coffee revolution that reflects both its rich heritage and modern aspirations, with cosmopolitan cities, such as Dubai and Abu Dhabi, having witnessed a surge in specialty cafés, boutique roasters, and innovative concepts. Coffee Market Overview The UAE coffee market is witnessing remarkable growth, with per capita consumption in the country reaching 1.36 kg in 2023 and market sales surpassing AED 1 billion. The UAE’s coffee market is projected to grow at an annual rate of 8.4% through 2029. The coffee culture in the UAE has been rapidly gaining momentum, with a notable rise in the number of cafes and roastery chains across the country. Saeed Alsuwaidi, Director of Agri Commodities at DMCC, highlighted that the thriving coffee market in the UAE presents significant opportunities for companies across the value chain, driving increased demand for premium coffee products.  Bridge Between the Past and the Present Arabic coffee or gahwa, holds deep cultural significance in the UAE and is a cornerstone of Emirati traditions. Serving gahwa is a key symbol of hospitality, representing respect, generosity, and friendship. Even when a lavish meal is offered, presenting gahwa completes the welcoming ritual. The preparation follows specific traditions, where the gahwa is brewed in a dallah and served in small, handleless cups, with refills offered until guests decline. Historically, gahwa has also fostered community and social connections. a cultural sitting place or majlis, has long served as important gathering spaces for men to discuss news, politics, and social matters. In these settings, gahwa plays a central role in strengthening community ties and maintaining social cohesion. In the past decade, the UAE has experienced a coffee revolution, evolving from a place of traditional gahwa to a hub for specialty beverage lovers with a discerning and expanding consumer base. What was once a region steeped in classic gahwa traditions has transformed into a vibrant community of innovative brews and premium brew. Key Industry Trends 1. Rise of Specialty Coffee: There has been a growing demand for high-quality, specialty coffee, with consumers becoming more knowledgeable and discerning about the origins and preparation methods of their coffee. Popular Specialty cafes in Dubai include: Mokha 1450, Qahwaty, and RAW Coffee Company.  Discover popular Japanese cafes in the UAE here 2. Non-Dairy Options: Health-conscious consumers are raising the bar, with Almond, oat, and soy milk have moved beyond being just options – they’re now expected to be made available across most if not all cafés in the UAE.  3. Sustainability: With a growing awareness of environmental issues, many brands in the UAE are embracing sustainability, from sourcing ethically produced beans to offering eco-friendly packaging. La Nena Specialty Café in Dubai, photo credits to: The HUNTR  World of Coffee Comes to Dubai 2025 Brew enthusiasts and industry leaders will gather in Dubai this February for World of Coffee (WOC) Dubai 2025, featuring its inaugural DMCC Specialty Coffee Auction. This event will showcase some of the world’s rarest and most exquisite beans, available for bidding. In partnership with the Dubai Multi Commodities Centre (DMCC), WOC Dubai offers buyers from around the globe, including top producers, the opportunity to bid on 20 exclusive lots of specialty-grade beans. The auction will be conducted both in-person and remotely via a state-of-the-art digital platform. The beans being auctioned are exclusive in nature, scoring 92 points or higher on the Specialty Coffee Association’s 100-point scale. As prices for high-rated beans continue to rise, a new record was set earlier this year when the Elida Geisha Natural Torre from the Lamastus Family Estate sold for US $10,013 per kilogram. Other rare black gold items, such as Black Ivory from Thailand and Kopi Luwak from Indonesia, can fetch prices up to $1,500 and $1,200 per kilogram, respectively. The Outlook The black gold culture in the UAE is a unique blend of past and present. From the rich traditions of Arabic gahwa to the sleek sophistication of specialty cafés, the country has embraced caffeine as both an art form and a social cornerstone. As the industry continues to grow, the UAE solidifies its position not just as a global coffee hotspot but as a cultural melting pot where tradition and innovation brew side by side.

The post Brewing Luxury: Coffee Culture Boom in the UAE appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
Coffee has taken center stage as an integral part of the social and cultural landscape in the UAE, with over 8,800 operating cafés across the country. The UAE is experiencing a dynamic coffee revolution that reflects both its rich heritage and modern aspirations, with cosmopolitan cities, such as Dubai and Abu Dhabi, having witnessed a surge in specialty cafés, boutique roasters, and innovative concepts.

Coffee Market Overview

The UAE coffee market is witnessing remarkable growth, with per capita consumption in the country reaching 1.36 kg in 2023 and market sales surpassing AED 1 billion. The UAE’s coffee market is projected to grow at an annual rate of 8.4% through 2029.
 
The coffee culture in the UAE has been rapidly gaining momentum, with a notable rise in the number of cafes and roastery chains across the country. Saeed Alsuwaidi, Director of Agri Commodities at DMCC, highlighted that the thriving coffee market in the UAE presents significant opportunities for companies across the value chain, driving increased demand for premium coffee products.
 

Bridge Between the Past and the Present

Arabic coffee or gahwa, holds deep cultural significance in the UAE and is a cornerstone of Emirati traditions. Serving gahwa is a key symbol of hospitality, representing respect, generosity, and friendship. Even when a lavish meal is offered, presenting gahwa completes the welcoming ritual. The preparation follows specific traditions, where the gahwa is brewed in a dallah and served in small, handleless cups, with refills offered until guests decline.

Historically, gahwa has also fostered community and social connections. a cultural sitting place or majlis, has long served as important gathering spaces for men to discuss news, politics, and social matters. In these settings, gahwa plays a central role in strengthening community ties and maintaining social cohesion.

In the past decade, the UAE has experienced a coffee revolution, evolving from a place of traditional gahwa to a hub for specialty beverage lovers with a discerning and expanding consumer base. What was once a region steeped in classic gahwa traditions has transformed into a vibrant community of innovative brews and premium brew.

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

Key Industry Trends

1. Rise of Specialty Coffee: There has been a growing demand for high-quality, specialty coffee, with consumers becoming more knowledgeable and discerning about the origins and preparation methods of their coffee. Popular Specialty cafes in Dubai include: Mokha 1450, Qahwaty, and RAW Coffee Company. 

Discover popular Japanese cafes in the UAE here

2. Non-Dairy Options: Health-conscious consumers are raising the bar, with Almond, oat, and soy milk have moved beyond being just options – they’re now expected to be made available across most if not all cafés in the UAE. 

3. Sustainability: With a growing awareness of environmental issues, many brands in the UAE are embracing sustainability, from sourcing ethically produced beans to offering eco-friendly packaging.

La Nena Specialty Café in Dubai, photo credits to: The HUNTR 

World of Coffee Comes to Dubai 2025

Brew enthusiasts and industry leaders will gather in Dubai this February for World of Coffee (WOC) Dubai 2025, featuring its inaugural DMCC Specialty Coffee Auction. This event will showcase some of the world’s rarest and most exquisite beans, available for bidding.

In partnership with the Dubai Multi Commodities Centre (DMCC), WOC Dubai offers buyers from around the globe, including top producers, the opportunity to bid on 20 exclusive lots of specialty-grade beans. The auction will be conducted both in-person and remotely via a state-of-the-art digital platform.

The beans being auctioned are exclusive in nature, scoring 92 points or higher on the Specialty Coffee Association’s 100-point scale. As prices for high-rated beans continue to rise, a new record was set earlier this year when the Elida Geisha Natural Torre from the Lamastus Family Estate sold for US $10,013 per kilogram. Other rare black gold items, such as Black Ivory from Thailand and Kopi Luwak from Indonesia, can fetch prices up to $1,500 and $1,200 per kilogram, respectively.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

The Outlook

The black gold culture in the UAE is a unique blend of past and present. From the rich traditions of Arabic gahwa to the sleek sophistication of specialty cafés, the country has embraced caffeine as both an art form and a social cornerstone. As the industry continues to grow, the UAE solidifies its position not just as a global coffee hotspot but as a cultural melting pot where tradition and innovation brew side by side.

item.title: Top 7 Pet-Friendly Cafes in Abu Dhabi & Dubai
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
For pet lovers in the UAE, finding a café or restaurant that welcomes furry companions can be a game-changer. Outdoor seating areas, in particular, are ideal for enjoying the cooler weather, making it the perfect season to dine al fresco with your four-legged friend. Here’s a list of the top 7 pet-friendly restaurants in these two cities where you and your four-legged friends can enjoy delightful dining experiences.  1. Arrows & Sparrows – Dubai Located in The Greens, Arrows & Sparrows is a vibrant cafe that welcomes pets in its spacious outdoor seating area. Known for its artisanal coffee and wholesome dishes, this spot is perfect for a relaxed morning or afternoon with your furry friend. Staff often provide water bowls for pets, ensuring they’re as comfortable as you are. 2. Diablito – Abu Dhabi Nestled in the vibrant Yas Marina, Diablito is a pet-friendly waterfront gem offering a Mediterranean-inspired menu of tapas, pizzas, paellas, and more, paired with stunning marina views. Open daily, it welcomes small and medium pets indoors, while larger dogs can enjoy the spacious outdoor terrace, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed meal with your furry companion. 3. Brunch & Cake – Dubai Brunch & Cake by the Sea, located at Pavilion in Jumeirah Islands, offers a spacious café with stunning lake views and a bakery serving fresh bread and cakes. Known for its fresh, beautifully presented dishes like carrot cake, French toast, and eggs benedict, it features a bright, pet-friendly ambiance with no size restrictions. Open daily, it provides water bowls, retractable glass doors, and accessible amenities, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing, dog-friendly brunch. photo credits to: Brunch & Cake 4. The Sportsman’s Arm – Abu Dhabi Located in Zayed Sports City, The Sportsman’s Arms is a family-friendly sports bar with a pet-friendly outdoor terrace and a play area for kids. Known for its relaxed vibe and standout Sunday roast, it’s the perfect spot to enjoy a meal with your furry companion by your side.  5. Café Artois – Dubai Situated at the JW Marriott Marquis Dubai, Café Artois offers a pet-friendly waterfront terrace with stunning Dubai Canal views. Guests can enjoy a diverse food and drink menu, while pets are welcome outdoors with water bowls provided. Photo credits to: OpenTable.hk  6. Éla Éla – Abu Dhabi Éla Éla brings the vibrant flavors of traditional Cretan cuisine with a modern twist, offering an engaging yet comforting dining experience. Embracing Mediterranean hospitality, it welcomes you and your pets as part of the family, celebrating the sunlit charm of Crete and the joy of exceptional food.  7. Elli’s Café – Dubai Elli’s Café, renowned for its homemade Mediterranean cuisine, doubles as a cozy co-working space. This dog-friendly spot is located on Palm Jumeirah and features a pet-friendly outdoor area, comfortable seating, strong Wi-Fi, and a location near gyms, making it a go-to for health-conscious options like smoothies. photo credits to: TripAdvisor   

The post Top 7 Pet-Friendly Cafes in Abu Dhabi & Dubai appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
For pet lovers in the UAE, finding a café or restaurant that welcomes furry companions can be a game-changer. Outdoor seating areas, in particular, are ideal for enjoying the cooler weather, making it the perfect season to dine al fresco with your four-legged friend. Here’s a list of the top 7 pet-friendly restaurants in these two cities where you and your four-legged friends can enjoy delightful dining experiences. 

1. Arrows & Sparrows - Dubai

Located in The Greens, Arrows & Sparrows is a vibrant cafe that welcomes pets in its spacious outdoor seating area. Known for its artisanal coffee and wholesome dishes, this spot is perfect for a relaxed morning or afternoon with your furry friend. Staff often provide water bowls for pets, ensuring they’re as comfortable as you are.

2. Diablito - Abu Dhabi

Nestled in the vibrant Yas Marina, Diablito is a pet-friendly waterfront gem offering a Mediterranean-inspired menu of tapas, pizzas, paellas, and more, paired with stunning marina views. Open daily, it welcomes small and medium pets indoors, while larger dogs can enjoy the spacious outdoor terrace, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed meal with your furry companion.
 

3. Brunch & Cake - Dubai

Brunch & Cake by the Sea, located at Pavilion in Jumeirah Islands, offers a spacious café with stunning lake views and a bakery serving fresh bread and cakes. Known for its fresh, beautifully presented dishes like carrot cake, French toast, and eggs benedict, it features a bright, pet-friendly ambiance with no size restrictions. Open daily, it provides water bowls, retractable glass doors, and accessible amenities, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing, dog-friendly brunch.
 
photo credits to: Brunch & Cake

4. The Sportsman's Arm - Abu Dhabi

Located in Zayed Sports City, The Sportsman’s Arms is a family-friendly sports bar with a pet-friendly outdoor terrace and a play area for kids. Known for its relaxed vibe and standout Sunday roast, it’s the perfect spot to enjoy a meal with your furry companion by your side.
 

5. Café Artois - Dubai

Situated at the JW Marriott Marquis Dubai, Café Artois offers a pet-friendly waterfront terrace with stunning Dubai Canal views. Guests can enjoy a diverse food and drink menu, while pets are welcome outdoors with water bowls provided.
 
Photo credits to: OpenTable.hk
 

6. Éla Éla - Abu Dhabi

Éla Éla brings the vibrant flavors of traditional Cretan cuisine with a modern twist, offering an engaging yet comforting dining experience. Embracing Mediterranean hospitality, it welcomes you and your pets as part of the family, celebrating the sunlit charm of Crete and the joy of exceptional food.
 

7. Elli's Café - Dubai

Elli’s Café, renowned for its homemade Mediterranean cuisine, doubles as a cozy co-working space. This dog-friendly spot is located on Palm Jumeirah and features a pet-friendly outdoor area, comfortable seating, strong Wi-Fi, and a location near gyms, making it a go-to for health-conscious options like smoothies.
 
photo credits to: TripAdvisor

item.title: Dubai’s Luxury Market: A Magnet for the Wealthy
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
Dubai’s luxury real estate market has been experiencing a remarkable surge in recent years, solidifying its position as a global hub for opulent living. Renowned for its architectural marvels, world-class amenities, and unparalleled lifestyle offerings, the city has become a magnet for the world’s elite, with a regular influx of high net-worth individuals since 2020. Despite the surge in property prices for luxury properties, the city offers superior value compared to other cities worldwide.  Concentration of High-Net-Worth Individuals Dubai has solidified its reputation as a global hub for wealth, with over 72,000 millionaires now calling the city home, according to the World’s Wealthiest Cities Report 2024 by Henley & Partners. Boasting the highest concentration of affluent individuals in the Middle East, Dubai’s wealthy residents collectively hold a net worth exceeding Dh3.7 trillion.  Property Price Surge Amidst High Demand “Dubai’s prime residential market has seen remarkable growth, expanding by 26.3 percent over the past 12 months. This follows a 16.3 percent rise in 2023 and an extraordinary 44.4 percent surge in 2022, solidifying its position as one of the fastest-growing prime residential markets in the world,” stated Faisal Durrani, partner and head of Middle East research at Knight Frank. According to a report communicated through Khaleej Times, Dubai’s luxury market witnessed 2405 ready and off-plan sales transactions for properties valued above AED 15 million as of November 2024, witnessing slightly over 2% increase from the past year. The most expensive apartment sold for AED 240.5 million and the most expensive villa sold for AED 203 million. Both properties are located on Palm Jumeirah.  A compelling factor driving Dubai’s luxury real estate market is its relative affordability. For instance, a million-dollar investment can secure a substantial 1,000-square-foot property in prime locations, making it a lucrative proposition for high-net-worth individuals.  Luxury Developments Set for 2025 In the upcoming years, Dubai’s luxury market is set to witness a drastic transformation as many high-end developments hand over. The most anticipated luxury developments, set to be ready by this upcoming year, include:   1. One Crescent at Palm Jumeirah  One Crescent, a prestigious landmark, graces the iconic Palm Jumeirah. This refined development features an exclusive collection of just 25 luxury residences, including 3 to 6-bedroom penthouses, sky villas, and sky mansions. Designed by the acclaimed Shaun Killa, the ground plus nine-storey masterpiece offers breathtaking views of the Palm and the ocean. This development is scheduled for handover in Q1 2025.    2. Eden House the Canal at Jumeirah 2 Eden House The Canal is a six-story low-rise architectural gem, featuring 88 meticulously designed residences. The offerings range from cozy studios to luxurious 4-bedroom suites and spacious garden duplexes. The development also includes seven exclusive villas, complete with pool terraces, private gardens, staff quarters, and dedicated parking.    3. Beach Mansion at Emaar Beachfront  Beach Mansion at Emaar Beachfront presents an exclusive collection of 1, 2, 3, and 4-bedroom apartments, townhouses, and duplex penthouses, all featuring premium amenities. It offers breathtaking Marina views and will soon stand as the last tower adjacent to the district’s only park. This development is scheduled for handover towards the end of 2025.      

The post Dubai’s Luxury Market: A Magnet for the Wealthy appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
Dubai’s luxury real estate market has been experiencing a remarkable surge in recent years, solidifying its position as a global hub for opulent living. Renowned for its architectural marvels, world-class amenities, and unparalleled lifestyle offerings, the city has become a magnet for the world’s elite, with a regular influx of high net-worth individuals since 2020. Despite the surge in property prices for luxury properties, the city offers superior value compared to other cities worldwide. 

Concentration of High-Net-Worth Individuals

Dubai has solidified its reputation as a global hub for wealth, with over 72,000 millionaires now calling the city home, according to the World’s Wealthiest Cities Report 2024 by Henley & Partners. Boasting the highest concentration of affluent individuals in the Middle East, Dubai’s wealthy residents collectively hold a net worth exceeding Dh3.7 trillion.
 

Property Price Surge Amidst High Demand

“Dubai’s prime residential market has seen remarkable growth, expanding by 26.3 percent over the past 12 months. This follows a 16.3 percent rise in 2023 and an extraordinary 44.4 percent surge in 2022, solidifying its position as one of the fastest-growing prime residential markets in the world,” stated Faisal Durrani, partner and head of Middle East research at Knight Frank.
 
According to a report communicated through Khaleej Times, Dubai’s luxury market witnessed 2405 ready and off-plan sales transactions for properties valued above AED 15 million as of November 2024, witnessing slightly over 2% increase from the past year. The most expensive apartment sold for AED 240.5 million and the most expensive villa sold for AED 203 million. Both properties are located on Palm Jumeirah. 
 
A compelling factor driving Dubai’s luxury real estate market is its relative affordability. For instance, a million-dollar investment can secure a substantial 1,000-square-foot property in prime locations, making it a lucrative proposition for high-net-worth individuals.
 

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

Luxury Developments Set for 2025

In the upcoming years, Dubai’s luxury market is set to witness a drastic transformation as many high-end developments hand over. The most anticipated luxury developments, set to be ready by this upcoming year, include: 
 

1. One Crescent at Palm Jumeirah 

One Crescent, a prestigious landmark, graces the iconic Palm Jumeirah. This refined development features an exclusive collection of just 25 luxury residences, including 3 to 6-bedroom penthouses, sky villas, and sky mansions. Designed by the acclaimed Shaun Killa, the ground plus nine-storey masterpiece offers breathtaking views of the Palm and the ocean. This development is scheduled for handover in Q1 2025.

 
 

2. Eden House the Canal at Jumeirah 2

Eden House The Canal is a six-story low-rise architectural gem, featuring 88 meticulously designed residences. The offerings range from cozy studios to luxurious 4-bedroom suites and spacious garden duplexes. The development also includes seven exclusive villas, complete with pool terraces, private gardens, staff quarters, and dedicated parking.
 

 

3. Beach Mansion at Emaar Beachfront 

Beach Mansion at Emaar Beachfront presents an exclusive collection of 1, 2, 3, and 4-bedroom apartments, townhouses, and duplex penthouses, all featuring premium amenities. It offers breathtaking Marina views and will soon stand as the last tower adjacent to the district’s only park. This development is scheduled for handover towards the end of 2025.

item.title: UAE’s Initiatives for a Thriving Family-Friendly Future
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
“Family in a national priority”, quotes HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid, prime minister and ruler of Dubai. The UAE has undergone a remarkable transformation in recent years, evolving into a family-friendly destination that caters to the needs of residents and visitors alike. Following his announcement of the establishment of the Ministry Of Family back on Sunday, and with a strong emphasis on community well-being and a commitment to providing a high quality of life, the UAE continues to implement a range of initiatives to support families and create a nurturing environment for children. Child-Friendly Initiatives The UAE has embraced the Child-Friendly Cities Initiative (CFCI), with Sharjah and Abu Dhabi leading the way, notably through Sharjah Child Friendly City. These cities have implemented various programs and policies aimed at promoting the well-being of children, including:  Child-Friendly Urban Planning: Creating safe and inclusive spaces for children to play, learn, and grow. The Sharjah Child Friendly City (SCFC) has launched this initiative back in 2017 by partnering with the Sharjah Urban Planning Council, UNICEF, and UN Habitat. In 2018, Sharjah became the first city in the world to receive the “child friendly city” title. Early Childhood Education: Investing in high-quality early childhood education programs to provide a strong foundation for children’s development. In October, the ECD Research Convening brought together over 90 researchers from the UAE, the Arab region, and Africa to foster collaboration and innovation in early childhood development (ECD), address challenges and explore opportunities for advancing a more inclusive and representative science in the field.   Child Protection: The UAE recognizes the importance of family foundations and, therefore, implementing robust child protection measures to ensure the safety and well-being of children. The 2018 National Family Policy exemplifies the UAE’s commitment to promoting family happiness and unity. Family Support: Offering a range of family support services, such as counseling, parenting workshops, and childcare facilities. The Social Welfare Program is also an important aspect, encompassing a wide range of beneficiaries, including widows, divorced women, people of determination, orphans, children without known parents, low-income individuals, and various other groups. Parent-Friendly Environments The Parent-Friendly Label™ (PFL) is a voluntary, UNICEF Gulf-backed workplace award program implemented across the UAE. It enables organizations in the semi-governmental, private, and third sectors to earn recognition for fostering a supportive work culture and implementing policies that positively impact children aged 0-8. Numerous organizations throughout the UAE have already embraced this initiative, benefiting over 148,000 employees and more than 50,000 children so far. In Education, “Family First” initiative was launched by HH Sheikh Nahyan bin Mubarak Al Nahyan, minister of Tolerance, at the GEMS World Academy Dubai earlier this year. This initiative for change inspires GEMS families to spend more quality time together, explore new experiences, and unlock the untapped wisdom and knowledge within their households that often go unnoticed. In 2024, planned Family First activations include a comprehensive survey on family values, monthly TED Talk-style discussions led by global experts and advocates on various aspects of family support, and a year-end gala celebrating stories that embody the principles of Family First. Family-Friendly Communities The UAE’s vibrant communities offer a wide range of amenities and activities for families. From world-class schools and healthcare facilities to recreational parks and cultural attractions, there is something for everyone. Many communities also have dedicated family-friendly events and festivals throughout the year, fostering a sense of belonging and togetherness. Explore Family-Friendly Communities in the UAE.  The Outlook: A Bright Future for Families The UAE’s commitment to family-friendly initiatives is evident in its ongoing efforts to create a nurturing and supportive environment for families. As the country continues to grow and develop, it is poised to become an even more attractive destination for families seeking a high quality of life. 

The post UAE’s Initiatives for a Thriving Family-Friendly Future appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
“Family in a national priority”, quotes HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid, prime minister and ruler of Dubai. The UAE has undergone a remarkable transformation in recent years, evolving into a family-friendly destination that caters to the needs of residents and visitors alike. Following his announcement of the establishment of the Ministry Of Family back on Sunday, and with a strong emphasis on community well-being and a commitment to providing a high quality of life, the UAE continues to implement a range of initiatives to support families and create a nurturing environment for children.

Child-Friendly Initiatives

The UAE has embraced the Child-Friendly Cities Initiative (CFCI), with Sharjah and Abu Dhabi leading the way, notably through Sharjah Child Friendly City. These cities have implemented various programs and policies aimed at promoting the well-being of children, including: 

  • Child-Friendly Urban Planning: Creating safe and inclusive spaces for children to play, learn, and grow. The Sharjah Child Friendly City (SCFC) has launched this initiative back in 2017 by partnering with the Sharjah Urban Planning Council, UNICEF, and UN Habitat. In 2018, Sharjah became the first city in the world to receive the “child friendly city” title.
  • Early Childhood Education: Investing in high-quality early childhood education programs to provide a strong foundation for children’s development. In October, the ECD Research Convening brought together over 90 researchers from the UAE, the Arab region, and Africa to foster collaboration and innovation in early childhood development (ECD), address challenges and explore opportunities for advancing a more inclusive and representative science in the field.  
  • Child Protection: The UAE recognizes the importance of familial foundations and, therefore, implementing robust child protection measures to ensure the safety and well-being of children. The 2018 National Family Policy exemplifies the UAE’s commitment to promoting household happiness and unity.
  • Family Support: Offering a range of  support services, such as counseling, parenting workshops, and childcare facilities. The Social Welfare Program is also an important aspect, encompassing a wide range of beneficiaries, including widows, divorced women, people of determination, orphans, children without known parents, low-income individuals, and various other groups.

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

Parent-Friendly Environments

The Parent-Friendly Label (PFL) is a voluntary, UNICEF Gulf-backed workplace award program implemented across the UAE. It enables organizations in the semi-governmental, private, and third sectors to earn recognition for fostering a supportive work culture and implementing policies that positively impact children aged 0-8. Numerous organizations throughout the UAE have already embraced this initiative, benefiting over 148,000 employees and more than 50,000 children so far.

In Education, “Family First” initiative was launched by HH Sheikh Nahyan bin Mubarak Al Nahyan, minister of Tolerance, at the GEMS World Academy Dubai earlier this year. This initiative for change inspires GEMS families to spend more quality time together, explore new experiences, and unlock the untapped wisdom and knowledge within their households that often go unnoticed.

In 2024, planned activations include a comprehensive survey on household values, monthly TED Talk-style discussions led by global experts and advocates on various aspects of family support, and a year-end gala celebrating stories that embody the principles of this project. 

Family-Friendly Communities

The UAE’s vibrant communities offer a wide range of amenities and activities for families. From world-class schools and healthcare facilities to recreational parks and cultural attractions, there is something for everyone. Many communities also have dedicated events and festivals throughout the year, fostering a sense of belonging and togetherness.

Explore Family-Friendly Communities in the UAE. 

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

The Outlook: A Bright Future for Families

The UAE’s commitment to family-friendly initiatives is evident in its ongoing efforts to create a nurturing and supportive environment for families. As the country continues to grow and develop, it is poised to become an even more attractive destination for families seeking a high quality of life.

item.title: Gen-Z at the Forefront: New Era in Dubai Real Estate
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
Dubai’s real estate landscape is undergoing a significant transformation, with Gen-Z buyers emerging as a dominant force. Generation Z, born between the late 1990s and early 2010s, is rapidly becoming the majority of property purchasers in the city. This generation, known for being Tech-Savvy and more environmentally conscious, is reshaping the market, driving demand for innovative, sustainable, and technologically advanced living spaces. Presence in the Market According to a recent report, communicated through Gulf News, Gen Z accounted for nearly 12% of all UAE real estate transactions in 2024. As this tech-savvy and socially conscious generation enters the housing market, they’re bringing new priorities that are reshaping the industry. To succeed in this evolving market, developers, agents, and sellers must understand the unique values and preferences of Gen Z homebuyers. Why Dubai Appeals to Gen Z Dubai’s appeal to Gen Z is multifaceted. The city’s cosmopolitan culture, tax-free environment, and world-class infrastructure are major draws. However, the primary reasons behind their interest in Dubai real estate are: Flexible Work Arrangements: The rise of remote work and digital nomadism, especially during and post-Covid pandemic, has empowered Gen Z to choose where they live and work. Dubai’s business-friendly policies and high-speed internet connectivity make it an ideal location for digital professionals.    Lifestyle and Entertainment: The city’s vibrant nightlife, diverse dining scene, and year-round sunshine appeal to Gen Z’s desire for a dynamic lifestyle. Investment Potential: Dubai’s real estate market has historically offered strong investment returns. Gen Z buyers are increasingly recognizing the city’s potential for long-term wealth growth, with diverse options that best suit their needs and budgets.      Sustainability and Innovation: Gen Z is environmentally conscious and seeks sustainable living solutions. Dubai’s commitment to green initiatives and smart city developments aligns with their values. AI-powered Solutions: As digital natives, they’re adept at navigating online platforms and leveraging technology. This translates to a strong preference for innovative real estate solutions in Dubai, such as virtual property tours, AI-powered property management, and blockchain-secured transactions. What Gen-Z is Looking for Generation Z approaches properties with a digital, affordable mind set. They have tendency to spend a lot of time surfing through the internet before they make the decision to contact a real estate consultant. They are more likely to be interested in properties through virtual property tours, which developers like Aldar Properties have been implementing, offering an immersive experience.  They are also entering the market with a logical mind set that aligns with their financial needs. Gen Z are more likely to prioritize smaller apartments, like studios or 1 bedroom apartments that would most cater to their needs. Therefore, they would most likely consider emerging areas like Dubai South as well as areas located within close proximity to entertainment attractions.  With affordability in mind, Gen-Z also values convenience and community. They would look for areas within proximity to metro stations, social hubs, and areas where they can walk or exercise freely. To capture the attention of these young buyers, developers, agents, and sellers must embrace their distinct combination of digital fluency, financial mindfulness, and eco-conscious values. The Outlook: A Bright Future Dubai’s residential real estate market is entering a new era with the growing presence of Gen Z, reflecting a shift in buyer demographics and showcasing the city’s adaptability to modern demands. From emerging neighborhoods to innovative smart homes, Dubai continues to solidify its status as a global real estate leader, offering dynamic opportunities for both buyers and investors in an ever-evolving market.

The post Gen-Z at the Forefront: New Era in Dubai Real Estate appeared first on Only Luxury.

With Gen-Z buyers emerging as a dominant force, Dubai’s real estate landscape is undergoing a significant transformation. Generation Z, born between the late 1990s and early 2010s, is rapidly becoming the majority of property purchasers in the city. This generation, known for being Tech-Savvy and more environmentally conscious, is reshaping the market, driving demand for innovative, sustainable, and technologically advanced living spaces.

Presence in the Market

According to a recent report, communicated through Gulf News, Gen-Z accounted for nearly 12% of all UAE real estate transactions in 2024. As this tech-savvy and socially conscious generation enters the housing market, they’re bringing new priorities that are reshaping the industry. To succeed in this evolving market, developers, agents, and sellers must understand the unique values and preferences of Gen-Z homebuyers.

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

Why Dubai Appeals to Gen Z

Dubai’s appeal to Gen-Z is multifaceted. The city’s cosmopolitan culture, tax-free environment, and world-class infrastructure are major draws. However, the primary reasons behind their interest in Dubai real estate are:

  • Flexible Work Arrangements: The rise of remote work and digital nomadism, especially during and post-Covid pandemic, has empowered Gen-Z to choose where they live and work. Dubai’s business-friendly policies and high-speed internet connectivity make it an ideal location for digital professionals.   
  • Lifestyle and Entertainment: The city’s vibrant nightlife, diverse dining scene, and year-round sunshine appeal to Gen-Z’s desire for a dynamic lifestyle.
  • Investment Potential: Dubai’s real estate market has historically offered strong investment returns. Gen-Z buyers are increasingly recognizing the city’s potential for long-term wealth growth, with diverse options that best suit their needs and budgets.     
  • Sustainability and Innovation: Gen-Z is environmentally conscious and seeks sustainable living solutions. Dubai’s commitment to green initiatives and smart city developments aligns with their values.
  • AI-powered Solutions: As digital natives, they’re adept at navigating online platforms and leveraging technology. This translates to a strong preference for innovative real estate solutions in Dubai, such as virtual property tours, AI-powered property management, and blockchain-secured transactions.

What Gen-Z is Looking for

Generation Z approaches properties with a digital, affordable mind set. They have tendency to spend a lot of time surfing through the internet before they make the decision to contact a real estate consultant. They are more likely to be interested in properties through virtual property tours, which developers like Aldar Properties have been implementing, offering an immersive experience. 

They are also entering the market with a logical mind set that aligns with their financial needs. Gen-Z are more likely to prioritize smaller apartments, like studios or 1 bedroom apartments that would most cater to their needs. Therefore, they would most likely consider emerging areas like Dubai South as well as areas located within close proximity to entertainment attractions. 

With affordability in mind, Gen-Z also values convenience and community. They would look for areas within proximity to metro stations, social hubs, and areas where they can walk or exercise freely. To capture the attention of these young buyers, developers, agents, and sellers must embrace their distinct combination of digital fluency, financial mindfulness, and eco-conscious values.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

The Outlook: A Bright Future

Dubai’s residential real estate market is entering a new era with the growing presence of Gen-Z, reflecting a shift in buyer demographics and showcasing the city’s adaptability to modern demands. From emerging neighborhoods to innovative smart homes, Dubai continues to solidify its status as a global real estate leader, offering dynamic opportunities for both buyers and investors in an ever-evolving market.

item.title: New Year’s Eve in Dubai 2024: Where to Celebrate
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
Dubai’s bustling life gets even more exciting during New Year’s celebrations! As the clock ticks close to midnight, Dubai transforms into a wonderous city of dazzling lights amidst limitless celebrations. From the record-breaking pyrotechnics at the Burj Khalifa to beachfront parties under starry skies, every corner of the city brims with excitement and elegance. Whether you’re seeking a lively countdown with thousands or an intimate soirée with stunning skyline views, Dubai ensures your New Year begins in extraordinary style. Fireworks in Action at the Burj Khalifa Fancy watching some fireworks at one of the world’s most iconic landmarks? Millions of tourists gather yearly awaiting one of the most televised new year’s celebrations: the iconic countdown at the Burj Khalifa with explosive fireworks to enter the new year with style! You will not only be entertained by the magical fireworks, but also the spectacular water show that takes place at the Dubai Fountain.  Live Entertainment on a Cruise An option for those who seek a cruising experience with live entertainment and dinner would be the iconic wooden dhow cruises. Guests are welcomed by a traditional Tanura dance and can enjoy a variety of international cuisine options. You have the option to book your ticket according to your preferred route, whether that would be along Dubai Marina, Dubai Creek or the Dubai Canal, while enjoying the views of the fireworks from various locations.  Masquerade Party at the Raffles For those seeking a high-end celebration immersed in extravagance, grab a mask and go to the Royal Masquerade Ball at Raffles The Palm Dubai this New Year’s Eve. This black-tie affair promises an unforgettable evening, featuring a lavish dinner and captivating performances by an eight-piece pop band alongside other dazzling acts. As the clock strikes midnight, the festivities carry on at the Sola Jazz Lounge afterparty, ensuring a celebration to remember. Electronic Music on Fire at Ushuaïa Dubai Harbor Ushuaïa Dubai Harbour Experience is hosting a special New Year’s Eve event featuring the Italian DJ and producer duo, Mathame. They will be unveiling their revolutionary NEO show, which blends technology with the unifying power of music to deliver an immersive and unforgettable experience. The show will feature a colossal humanoid monument as the centerpiece, inviting attendees into a forward-thinking, cinematic artistic vision. Souled Out at the Dubai Opera Bid farewell to 2024 in style at the iconic Dubai Opera, where an unforgettable evening of music, entertainment, and spectacular views awaits. The celebration kicks off at 8 PM with Dubai’s very own Souled Out band, energizing the night with smooth jazz classics and lively tunes. As the evening unfolds, the lineup intensifies with electrifying performances by renowned Austrian DJ Parov Stelar, known for his signature electro-swing beats, and DJ Silverfox, who will keep the energy soaring until 2 AM.

The post New Year’s Eve in Dubai 2024: Where to Celebrate appeared first on Only Luxury.

item.title: Innovative Real Estate Strategies in the UAE 2025
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
Real estate strategy has evolved beyond simple buy-and-hold methods. Today’s successful investors embrace artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, and data analytics to make informed decisions. These advancements transform how we analyze, purchase, and manage property investments in the UAE market. This guide explores groundbreaking strategies that combine technology with real estate investment, helping you stay ahead in the UAE’s dynamic property market. From PropTech solutions to crowdfunding, we’ll show you how to leverage these innovations for optimal returns in 2025. Leveraging PropTech for Smart Investments PropTech innovations are revolutionizing the UAE’s real estate investment landscape, with Dubai positioning itself as the epicenter of property technology advancement. Major companies are now allocating over 20% of their annual budgets to develop and implement cutting-edge solutions that transform how investors analyze, purchase, and manage properties. AI-powered property analysis tools The launch of TruEstimate, an AI-powered valuation tool developed in collaboration with the Dubai Land Department, marks a significant advancement in property analysis. This innovative platform processes extensive transactional data to provide accurate property valuations and market insights. Investors can now access: Detailed property valuations based on current market trends Comprehensive rental yield analysis Historical property data and price comparisons Automated cost breakdown for investments Remote Investing Dubai REST app offers comprehensive features for beneficiaries of off-plan projects, including real-time updates on project progress, escrow account details, payment schedules, and actual project images. Users can mark favorite projects for easier follow-up. It also provides a real estate wallet on smart devices, allowing property owners to manage transactions such as sales, purchases, leases, and mortgages seamlessly. Additionally, the app delivers insights on real estate brokers, valuation companies, management firms, and certified developers, while offering key services like submitting rental disputes, requesting valuation certificates, and generating property maps. With integrated features like the rental, sales, and service charge indices, alongside Noqodi’s secure e-payment portal, the app ensures a streamlined user experience in Arabic and English on Android and Apple platforms. Digital Real Estate Investment Platforms The democratization of UAE’s real estate market is reaching new heights through digital investment platforms, making property ownership accessible to a broader range of investors. These innovative platforms are transforming how people invest in real estate, offering opportunities previously reserved for high-net-worth individuals. Real estate crowdfunding opportunities Digital platforms have revolutionized property investment through crowdfunding models. SmartCrowd, UAE’s first DFSA-regulated platform, enables investments starting from AED 500, with over 30,000 registered users benefiting from: Data-driven property analysis Transparent ownership structures Monthly rental income distributions Bi-annual exit windows Professional portfolio management Similarly, Stake has emerged as a prominent platform, amassing over 800,000 users and facilitating more than AED 555 million sales transactions in value across different countries, demonstrating the growing appetite for digital real estate investments. The Outlook Real estate investment in UAE stands at an exciting crossroads where technology meets traditional property markets. Smart investors who embrace these innovative strategies position themselves for success in 2025 and beyond. PropTech solutions, digital platforms, and automated systems now make property investment more accessible and efficient than ever before.

The post Innovative Real Estate Strategies in the UAE 2025 appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
Real estate strategy has evolved beyond simple buy-and-hold methods. Today’s successful investors embrace artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, and data analytics to make informed decisions. These advancements transform how we analyze, purchase, and manage property investments in the UAE market.

This guide explores groundbreaking strategies that combine technology with real estate investment, helping you stay ahead in the UAE’s dynamic property market. From PropTech solutions to crowdfunding, we’ll show you how to leverage these innovations for optimal returns in 2025.

Leveraging PropTech for Smart Investments

PropTech innovations are revolutionizing the UAE’s real estate investment landscape, with Dubai positioning itself as the epicenter of property technology advancement. Major companies are now allocating over 20% of their annual budgets to develop and implement cutting-edge solutions that transform how investors analyze, purchase, and manage properties.

AI-powered property analysis tools

The launch of TruEstimate, an AI-powered valuation tool developed in collaboration with the Dubai Land Department, marks a significant advancement in property analysis. This innovative platform processes extensive transactional data to provide accurate property valuations and market insights. Investors can now access:

  • Detailed property valuations based on current market trends

  • Comprehensive rental yield analysis

  • Historical property data and price comparisons

  • Automated cost breakdown for investments

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

Remote Investing

Dubai REST app offers comprehensive features for beneficiaries of off-plan projects, including real-time updates on project progress, escrow account details, payment schedules, and actual project images. Users can mark favorite projects for easier follow-up. It also provides a real estate wallet on smart devices, allowing property owners to manage transactions such as sales, purchases, leases, and mortgages seamlessly.

Additionally, the app delivers insights on real estate brokers, valuation companies, management firms, and certified developers, while offering key services like submitting rental disputes, requesting valuation certificates, and generating property maps. With integrated features like the rental, sales, and service charge indices, alongside Noqodi’s secure e-payment portal, the app ensures a streamlined user experience in Arabic and English on Android and Apple platforms.

Digital Real Estate Investment Platforms

The democratization of UAE’s real estate market is reaching new heights through digital investment platforms, making property ownership accessible to a broader range of investors. These innovative platforms are transforming how people invest in real estate, offering opportunities previously reserved for high-net-worth individuals.

Real estate crowdfunding opportunities

Digital platforms have revolutionized property investment through crowdfunding models. SmartCrowd, UAE’s first DFSA-regulated platform, enables investments starting from AED 500, with over 30,000 registered users benefiting from:

  • Data-driven property analysis

  • Transparent ownership structures

  • Monthly rental income distributions

  • Bi-annual exit windows

  • Professional portfolio management

Similarly, Stake has emerged as a prominent platform, amassing over 800,000 users and facilitating more than AED 555 million sales transactions in value across different countries, demonstrating the growing appetite for digital real estate investments.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

The Outlook

Real estate investment in UAE stands at an exciting crossroads where technology meets traditional property markets. Smart investors who embrace these innovative strategies position themselves for success in 2025 and beyond. PropTech solutions, digital platforms, and automated systems now make property investment more accessible and efficient than ever before.

Leave a Message

The post Innovative Real Estate Strategies in the UAE 2025 appeared first on Only Luxury.
